name: Mashed
description: Compete over 13 challenging and diverse environments using whatever means necessary to batter and bruise your opponents into submission, and claim victory for yourself!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 98/2000/ME/XP Processor: Pentium PIII 800 MHz Processor or AMD Athlon Memory: 256 MB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce™ or ATI Radeon™  7000 or higher Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Looking for a local multiplayer game to play with your friends at home all night long? This game is what you're looking for.   Mashed is a racing game where the main objective is to  win other cars by distance or by destroying them . Each racing session is composed by rounds where each round gives/takes points depending on which place you've ended on the respective round, the first who gets its points bar full wins the racing session. If you lose and the round is still occuring, you can airstrike others until the round ends.   This game is a blast of a fun!
Playing this with friends on the same screen is really fun!

I've played Mashed: Fully Loaded alot on the PlayStation 2 & let me tell you, it was fun to play both solo & with a party. I would recommend getting that version on said platform.  The main problems with this game on this platform is that it's an outdated version hence the title. The port is a complete mess as it is unable to keep a consistent frame rate.

Broken, unfortunately. Physics are bugged; whenever you go off of a ramp the game acts as you hit an invisible wall. Fun game otherwise, if you really want it pick it up on sale.

Looks fun, but unfortunatly does not work. It gives a blank screen and then hangs. I had to let it sit at the launcher just so I had 5 minutes of play on record so I could submit a review. Not worth the risk.
I wish Wrecked would be in Steam....
I think i wasted a bit too much time on a childhood game. Yeah.. 'a bit' is an understatement, but still. The game is fun as hell when you're not forced to deal with it's bullcrap.

YOU KNOW THOSE FUN GAMES THAT PEOPLE CALL 'DESTROYER OF FRIENDSHIPS'?  this is one of those, the game is highly competitive due to the weapons in the game and how they can be used is entirely to your imagination, you can either rely on sheer skill or just be a ♥♥♥♥ to your friends if you want to, either way sometimes it won't always feel like your loss in the race is justified, but it will, trust me, just be really competitive int his game otherwise you're screwed, if you want a mariokart-esque kind of game for stem then this one is the game you're looking for. Also there is an anti-butthurt system in the game, if you die before your friend int he race you start playing as the camera that lets you lock on on any caracter in the race that you want and shoot a homing missile at it, so if you feel you got screwed over or trolled by that friend of yours, you can exact revenge, expecially considering that there is no limit to the amount of times you can use those missiles, so trolls, beware for butthurt gamers. A cheap fun game, what more do you want, get it, get it now, it's not like you can't afford it.  8/10 I gave it an 8 because despite it's competitiveness the game is just plain fun to play and easy to pick up too, unfortunately there is no online multiplayer option sadly.

This is a blast from the past. Literally. Bringing the chief mechanic of micro machines to full 3D with extra booms with races that can go on forever when you're evenly matched.  So many lost nights to this.
The most entertaining game i've played when i was young and still love it.
